text: Allegheny County () is a county in the southwest of the U.S. state of Pennsylvania. As of 2020 the population was 1,250,578. The county seat is Pittsburgh. Allegheny was Pennsylvania's first to bear a Native American name, being named after the Allegheny River. ==References== Category:1780s establishments in Pennsylvania Category:1788 establishments in the United States Category:Pennsylvania counties
title: Allegheny County, Pennsylvania
